channel.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
channel.description:
http://www.hostmonster.com/
Some features: 600 Gigabytes of Hosting Space 6,000 Gigabytes of bandwidth/month Free Domain Name Storage Backups
I'm thinking of trying the 24 month package. Wanted to see if it was any good or if they go nazi when you use up 50mb bandwidth.

item.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
item.dc:creator: @cause cause
item.description:
@cause wrote:

Do any sites offer that kind of storage? Or bandwidth? Also, can you directly download a torrent to a webserver? (no connection :P)

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:20, topic:169050”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=228708.msg2069844#msg2069844 date=1203643826]
Overselling is not bad. It is bad if it causes overloaded servers.

If the performance of your website is fine, why do you care if the hard drive isn’t 10 TB?
[/quote]

Nopman is right. The main reason they offer you that much space is to attract your attention. What they are thinking is who the hell is going to use THAT MUCH SPACE? I mean if you think about it probally half the people that use that service might only use up to 100 gigabytes. Im hosting my own server, and on the partition im using it has (apache, php, mysql, no-ip, firewall, anti-virus, smf) and it only takes 0.4 Gigabytes.[/quote]
Nopman? anyways i would say the average amount of people will use about 10-1500mb of diskspace, and also they put such high numbers because new people will not know about overselling and they will be like ‘BARGAIN’ so yeah its just a selling tactic

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:15, topic:169050”]Overselling is not bad. It is bad if it causes overloaded servers.

If the performance of your website is fine, why do you care if the hard drive isn’t 10 TB?[/quote]

Mopman is right. The main reason they offer you that much space is to attract your attention. What they are thinking is who the hell is going to use THAT MUCH SPACE? I mean if you think about it probally half the people that use that service might only use up to 100 gigabytes. Im hosting my own server, and on the partition im using it has (apache, php, mysql, no-ip, firewall, anti-virus, smf) and it only takes 0.4 Gigabytes.

EDIT:Mopman

Read full topic

Uh, yes you should. If you don’t, you’re an idiot.

you shouldn’t need to read the ToS though

item.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“error.login, post:16, topic:169050”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=228708.msg2069844#msg2069844 date=1203643826]
Overselling is not bad. It is bad if it causes overloaded servers.

If the performance of your website is fine, why do you care if the hard drive isn’t 10 TB?
[/quote]
because they are giving you false hope no way will they allow you to use 10TB[/quote]

Sure they will, as long as you don’t go over the other resource limits, which you will. But they have also told you of these resource limits beforehand, because you read the TOS, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“fluffymuff1n, post:12, topic:169050”]http://1and1.com
Billing is slow if you send in money, but otherwise its 99.99% uptime, i’ve never seen my site down, same with some friends of mine. And its fast and has like 150 gigs for $10 a/month and comes with 3 FREE domains.[/quote]
they are bad if you live the the uk though, because there datacenter in the uk has very bad support and not good but not as good system as in the us.

[quote=“Ollie, post:13, topic:169050”]www.byethost.com
they are really good, they offer free hosting if you only want a small amount aswell (no ads)[/quote]
imo i would go with that one because they offer alot less diskspace and bandwidth than hm so that there is little/non overselling involved with this company, as i said before overselling=bad

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:10, topic:169050”][quote author=Bang Train link=topic=228708.msg2067167#msg2067167 date=1203528662]
am i looking in the wrong spot or does it now say

space: 1,500 GB
bw: 15,000 GB/mo
[/quote]

Yes, they seem to have changed it a bit since the christmas promotion, it how has 1,500GB instead of 6,000(typo in first post) for space and 15,000GB/month bandwidth instead of 6,000. Gone up by a bit, too.[/quote]
you know that you will have a low cpu limit and they will restrict you to only using about 5-15gb diskspace, also overselling = bad.
they are offering 1.5tb diskspace for $6.50 p/m that means they will be giving you 3 hard drives to run your website for $6.50. its a bad choice if you ask me.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone tried this webhost before?
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:3, topic:169050”][quote author=JV link=topic=228708.msg1963303#msg1963303 date=1199031831]
My uncle uses hostmonster for his accountancy site.
He doesn’t use anything like that much bandwidth/space, but he said it’s good for beginners.
Perhaps that’s something to take into account?
-JV

[/quote]

I don’t really use the cpanel, so anything they have to make it look nice and fancy will be gone to waste. Usually, I’d make the web pages on my machine, and use ftp to upload them.[/quote]

Perhaps you could try and find someone who knows how good the FTP is there.
Is the package you’re thinking about signing up for expensive?
-JV

Read full topic
